sentence: ServiceMaster Global Holdings (NYSE: SERV) – a provider of residential and commercial termite and pest control services – saw its stock decline by close to 20% this week.
The sell-off came after the company announced weaker-than-expected preliminary revenues and EPS for Q3 2019.

While the company increased its full-year revenue outlook, on account of recent acquisitions, it cut its adjusted EBITDA forecast for the year to between $415 million and $425 million (previously expected at between $435 million and $445 million) Moreover, the company also said that the head of its Terminix Residential operations would be stepping down.
The Terminix segment accounted for 87% of the company’s revenue in 2018.
Below, we take a look at how ServiceMaster has fared in recent years and what the outlook could be like.
View our interactive dashboard analysis on Why Did ServiceMaster Global Holdings Stock Decline 20% This Week?
How does ServiceMaster Global Holdings’ Revenue Growth in 2018 compare with that in prior periods and what’s the forecast?
Total Revenues for ServiceMaster Global Holdings increased from $1.76 Bil in 2017 to $1.90 Bil in 2018; an increase of 8.26%.
This compares with Total Revenues growth of 1.68% in 2017 compared to 2016.
We expect Total Revenues growth to be 8% in 2019.
How does ServiceMaster Global Holdings’ Total Expense in 2018 compare with that in prior periods and what’s the forecast?
Total Expense for ServiceMaster Global Holdings significantly increased from $1.66 Bil in 2017 to $2.03 Bil in 2018; an increase of 22.3%.
This compares with Total Expense growth of -4.17% in 2017 compared to 2016.
We expect Total Expense growth to be -5.2% in 2019.
How does ServiceMaster Global Holdings’ EBT in 2018 compare with that in prior periods and what’s the forecast?
EBT for ServiceMaster Global Holdings decreased dramatically by -227% from $99.0 Mil in 2017 to -$126 Mil in 2018.
We expect EBT to stand at $130 million in 2019.
How do ServiceMaster Global Holdings’ Net Income and EPS in 2018 compare with that in prior periods and what’s the forecast?
